Unfortunately the address was wrong, but when I contacted them, within minutes they emailed me back, apologized, corrected everything and resent to the right address.  We all make a mistake once in a while.  These folks were SUPERB with correcting it, and I will happily do business with them again.

Ordering, speed of delivery, quality of product were all 5 star. Would definitely recommend doing business with them. Thank You!

Only suggestion is provide the hardware needed.  Wiring was easy, and was able to sync both sides with no difficulty.  Lights work and look amazing.  Agency is planning on purchasing for all our patrol units!

Review.Titre: Great products

Prior to placing my 2nd order I received an expired coupon code on 1/2/21 via email.  I asked if it could be honored due to the fact that it was emailed to me on 1/2/21 and expired on 12/31/20.  Despite not getting a response that was placed in my order, I will continue to order from Strobesnmore as I have constantly be pleased with their products, speed of shipping and the company as a whole.

Review.Titre: I only have positive feedback
Review.Contenu: I only have positive feedback. I love dealing with strobesnmore. Fast ship ,super priceing and a fantastic section of products. Coustomer service. Is also the best .can't wait for my next purchase. Thanks to everyone at strobesnmore.

Once I located my item, the order process was pretty good.  Shipping is a bit pricey, even for standard. Items seem to be priced well and are competitive with other suppliers.

I think i got missed and when I asked is when it was sent to me. other than that the light is great.

Review.Titre: This remote switch is small and easy to install.
Review.Contenu: This remote switch is small, so easy to find a mounting spot, but needs to be close to the battery as the power leads are short. Easy to hook up and with 4 separate switched circuits is enough for fog, driving, light bar, and either ditch, rear, or rock lights. The remote is small with good range. and comes with a visor clip, although I removed it to mount the remote flat with Velcro on the overhead console. I docked it one star as there are no on/off indicators to let you know if one circuit is left on in daylight. I added a key switched power (60amp) relay so all lights go off when the engine is turned off. All in all a much lower cost option to other switch boxes available on the off road market.

Review.Titre: Good Quality Products, But the Wiring Might Surprise You
Review.Contenu: After searching other sites, I’ve found that strobesnmore has a wider selection of good, quality, and affordable products (lights) that I need for work and for play. The videos they post are top notch, and give a great example on what the products (lights) can do. My only complaint is that they do not show the amount and type of wiring enough that a person has to do to get the products working correctly. For example, I recently bought a group of switches for an arrow light bar. The diagram on line only showed the basic wiring, so I had trouble figuring out which wire went where. Obviously red is positive, black is negative; but when all the wires are red, then what? After awhile of figuring it out, I got the light to work. It was just the agitation that I had to go through.

Review.Titre: Surface Star -- Great light overall!  But blue could be better.
Review.Contenu: SNM overall has been fantasitc -- good customer service, detailed information in their webstore, helpful videos, etc.The Surface Star is an excellent light, very compact, build quality seems great, *very* bright, love that it doesn't have an inline driver since in my application I had very limited space.Only complaint:  the blue color is washed out and mostly white with blue undertones.  I had to apply blue-tint vinyl wrap to get a decent blue color out of it, which makes it less bright (though it's still pretty bright, just not as bright as it could be).I assume the other colors do NOT suffer from the same color wash-out issue -- I've noticed across multiple manufacturers that blue is the most difficult to get right.At some point, I'll probably pick up the amber to replace my front and / or rear motorcycle turn signals.

That's perfect for a response mode and then just to have color on scene. I also did purchase the extra led lights because I will mount them either on the side of the grille guard or possibly in my headlights and thanks to the simplicity of the plug in style for the extra lights, it's so much easier now. I highly recommend this light!

Review.Titre: First time purchaser..
Review.Contenu: First time purchaser... installed 4 E6 dual color and 1 Millinion dual color Light Bar on a 2012 RAM... NOTE : the yellow wire is not compatible with the E6's like the person in the messaging indicated. Seems the mini light bar yellow wire is only compatible with another mini light bar. Other than that I'm happy with my purchase. Would like to make a suggestion though... I needed to extend the light bar power cord a full 12ft to work on a 2012 RAM Laramie mounted on a "BackRack".... I made my own wire loom (soldered and heat shrink connections), maybe you could offer as a service to extend the light bars power cord... looking forward to the next purchase... Will also consider purchase the multi strand wire from you next time...highly recommend the E6 Dual Color and Millinion Mini Light Bar! Especially for primary lighting.

Review.Titre: Quality Affordable Products
Review.Contenu: I have been using Srobes-N-More products for many years. They have high quality products at affordable prices. I use amber emergency warning lighting on my vehicles for the simple fact that I carry tools and stop to help motorists in need of help but don't want to get killed doing it. I use Strobes-N-More products on our work vehicles also for warning lighting. Just one example is a pair of E-6's that I put on the rear of my old company pick up truck cap. I received a newer company pick up truck three times now but that old Silverado with the E-6's is still in service. Those E-6's were disconnected for a while. I hooked up 12v power and a toggle switch and they still work just fine. They've been on the back of that truck cap as surface mount rear facing (Amber) warning lights for at least six years and we're still using them.Customer Service at Strobes-N-More gets a five star rating also. Not once have I called them and not spoken to someone that made sure that my question was answered before I hung up with them. They're the kind of people that you would feel comfortable just stopping in and saying hi if you were in R.I.If you have a business with vehicles that stop or stay on the side of the road (like landscaping vehicles), Strobes-N-More is the place to shop for affordable warning lighting.Thanks for listening,Joseph YuodisTolland County in Connecticut
